the path of severing the latent tendencies of ignorance that are to be eliminated by cultivation

answer: the path of severing the eye faculty

all sentient beings possess it

The path of abandoning the latent afflictions of the eye faculty up to the latent afflictions of the formless realm to be eliminated by cultivation,
the associated latent afflictions that increase due to the perceiving consciousness and the object-perceiving consciousness,
who possesses which, and who does not possess which.
The answer is: The path of abandoning the eye faculty,

the associated latent afflictions that increase due to the perceiving consciousness and the object-perceiving consciousness,ğŸ”½the latent afflictions that increaseğŸ”½are possessed by those who have not yet eliminated the afflictions of the formless realm,
and are not possessed by those who have already eliminated the afflictions of the formless realm.
The path of abandoning the ear, nose, tongue, body, life, mind, joy, pleasure, and equanimity faculties,
the associated latent afflictions that increase due to the perceiving consciousness and the object-perceiving consciousness are also like this.

The latent afflictions that increase due to the perceiving consciousness of the path of abandoning the female faculty,ğŸ”½are possessed by those who have not yet eliminated the afflictions of the form realm,
and are not possessed by those who have already eliminated the afflictions of the form realm.
The latent afflictions that increase due to the object-perceiving consciousness of this,ğŸ”½are possessed by those who have not yet eliminated the afflictions of the sphere of infinite space,
and are not possessed by those who have already eliminated the afflictions of the sphere of infinite space.
The path of abandoning the male, suffering, and sorrow faculties,ğŸ”½the associated latent afflictions that increase due to the perceiving consciousness and the object-perceiving consciousness,
are also like this.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
The eye faculty up to the formless realm.
The ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation that takes the consciousness as its object and the consciousness that takes it as its object.ğŸ”½When one attains the complete knowledge of the above,
among the ninety-eight latent afflictions,
how many latent afflictions are completely known?
How many of the nine fetters are eliminated?
Answer: When the consciousness that takes the eye faculty as its object attains complete knowledge,
the craving for the sphere of infinite space is exhausted.
At that time, the consciousness that takes the eye faculty as its object attains complete knowledge, but no fetters are eliminated.
When the consciousness that takes that as its object attains complete knowledge,
the craving for the formless realm is exhausted.
Three latent afflictions are completely known.
Three fetters are eliminated.
It is the same when the consciousness that takes the ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties as its object and the consciousness that takes that as its object attain complete knowledge.
When the consciousness that takes the female faculty as its object attains complete knowledge, the craving for the form realm is exhausted.
For ordinary beings, thirty-one latent afflictions
are completely known, but no fetters are eliminated.
For noble ones, three latent afflictions are completely known, but no fetters are eliminated.
When the consciousness that takes that as its object attains complete knowledge,
When the craving for the sphere of infinite space is exhausted,
when the knowledge of the object of the female faculty is completely understood, there is no termination of fetters.
When the knowledge of the object of the male faculty, the faculties of pain and sorrow, and the knowledge of the object of the object of these are completely understood, it is the same.
When the knowledge of the object of the life faculty and the knowledge of the object of the object of these are completely understood,
when the craving for the formless realm is exhausted,
when the knowledge of the object of the three faculties of intention, joy, and equanimity, and the five pure faculties such as faith are completely understood,
when the knowledge of the object of the object of these are completely understood, it is the same.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
The knowledge of the object of the eye faculty up to the ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm,
when the latent afflictions that increase with the knowledge of the object of the object of these are completely understood,

How many fetters are terminated?
Answer: When the latent afflictions that increase with the knowledge of the object of the eye faculty are completely understood,
when the craving for the sphere of infinite space is exhausted,
when the latent afflictions that increase with the knowledge of the object of the eye faculty are completely understood,
there is no termination of fetters.
The proclivities that are nourished by the perceptual consciousness that has this as its object,
when the complete knowledge of the destruction of desire for the formless realm is attained,
the complete knowledge of the three proclivities is attained,
and the three fetters are eliminated.
The ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties,

the proclivities that are nourished by the perceptual consciousness that has them as its object and by the perceptual consciousness that has their objects as its object, when the complete knowledge of the destruction of desire for the formless realm is attained,
the proclivities that are nourished by the perceptual consciousness that has the female faculty as its object,
when the complete knowledge of the destruction of desire for the form realm is attained,
ordinary beings attain the complete knowledge of thirty-one proclivities and do not eliminate any fetters,
while noble ones attain the complete knowledge of three proclivities and do not eliminate any fetters.
The proclivities that are nourished by the perceptual consciousness that has this as its object,
when the complete knowledge of the destruction of desire for the formless realm is attained,
the proclivities that are nourished by the perceptual consciousness that has the female faculty as its object and by the perceptual consciousness that has its objects as its object,
when the complete knowledge of the destruction of desire for the formless realm is attained,

the proclivities that are nourished by the perceptual consciousness that has the male faculty, the faculties of pain and sorrow, and the perceptual consciousness that has them as its object and by the perceptual consciousness that has their objects as its object, when the complete knowledge of the destruction of desire for the formless realm is attained,

the proclivities that are nourished by the perceptual consciousness that has the life faculty as its object and by the perceptual consciousness that has its objects as its object, when the complete knowledge of the destruction of desire for the formless realm is attained,
When the three latent afflictions are completely known, the three fetters are eliminated.
The faculties of mind, joy, pleasure, equanimity, faith, etc., and the three pure faculties.
When the latent afflictions that increase the perceiving consciousness and the perceiving-condition consciousness are completely known, it is also like this.
The meaning of the other chapters should be understood by analogy with this.

How many fetters are eliminated? Answer: When the perceiving consciousness of the cessation of the eye faculty is completely known, desire for form is exhausted.

When they are completely known, it is also like this.

Answer: When the consciousness that increases the latent afflictions conditioned by the cessation of the eye faculty is completely known, desire for form is exhausted.

For noble ones, three latent afflictions are completely known, but no bonds are eliminated.

For noble ones, three latent afflictions are completely known, but no bonds are eliminated.
When the consciousness that increases the latent afflictions conditioned by that object-condition is completely known, desire for the sphere of infinite space is exhausted.

and the consciousness that takes it as its object and the consciousness that takes the object of that [consciousness] as its object,
when the complete knowledge is attained, the desire of the formless realm is exhausted.

the consciousness that takes them as objects, and the consciousness that takes that as an object,

Answer: When the consciousness that takes the eye faculty as an object realizes the cessation of suffering,

when eliminating and realizing, attain the fruit of arhatship.

The consciousnesses that take as objects the path of eliminating the ear and so on up to the five faculties such as faith, as well as the consciousnesses that take as objects the objects of those, are the same.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
One who possesses the eye faculty up to the formless realm.
The dormant afflictions eliminated by cultivation and ignorance.ğŸ”½How many bonds are they bound by?

The answer: One who possesses the eye faculty.

They are defiled by six defilements.
They are entangled by ten entanglements.

They are bound by two bonds.

They are defiled by three defilements.
They are bound by two bonds.
Those who have abandoned first dhyÄna attachment,
are bound by six fetters.
They are bound by two bonds.
Nine latent afflictions increase.
They are defiled by one defilement.
They are entangled by two entanglements.
If noble ones who have not yet abandoned desire realm attachment enter the correct state of detachment from birth,
the knowledge of the similarity of suffering has not yet arisen.
They are bound by nine fetters.
They are bound by three bonds.
Ten latent afflictions increase. They are defiled by six defilements.
They are entangled by ten entanglements.
The knowledge of the similarity of suffering has arisen, but the knowledge of the similarity of the path has not yet arisen.
They are bound by nine fetters.
They are bound by three bonds.
Eight latent afflictions increase.
Six defilements taint.
Ten entanglements entangle.
Having already produced the knowledge of the class of the path, but not yet free from the defilements of desire,
One is bound by six fetters.
One is bound by three fetters.
Four latent afflictions increase.
Six defilements taint.

Having already become free from the defilements of desire, but not yet free from the defilements of the first meditation, one enters into the certainty of perfection.

One is bound by two fetters.
Nine latent afflictions increase.
Three defilements taint.
Two entanglements entangle.

One is bound by two fetters.

Having already produced the knowledge of the class of the path, but not yet free from the defilements of the first meditation,

One is bound by two fetters.ğŸ”½Three latent afflictions increase.

and is bound by the two entanglements.

One is entangled by the two entanglements.

Entangled by ten entanglements.
One who possesses the faculty of 'I shall come to know the unknown',
Not yet free from the stain of desire,

Bound by nine fetters.
Bound by three bonds.

Six defilements contaminate.
Ten entanglements entangle.
When the knowledge of the aspects of the truth of suffering has already arisen,

One is bound by three fetter-bonds.
Eight latent afflictions increase.
Six defilements contaminate.
Ten entanglements entangle.
Having already become free from the defilements of the desire realm, but not yet free from the defilements of the first concentration,
Entering the correct separation from birth, the knowledge of the aspects of the truth of suffering has not yet arisen.

When the knowledge of the aspects of the truth of suffering has already arisen,

As explained before for one who attains the eye faculty.

For the cessation of the ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm attained by one who attains the eye faculty up to the eye faculty,

The answer is: For the cessation of the eye faculty attained by one,

bound by two fetters,
and nine latent afflictions increase.
One is defiled by three defilements,
and entangled by two entanglements.

If a noble one who has not yet abandoned the defilements of the first dhyÄna enters the production of the correct view of separation from suffering, and the knowledge of the similarity of suffering has not yet arisen,

It is defiled by the three defilements.
It is bound by the two bonds.

It is bound by the two bonds.

It is defiled by the three defilements.
It is bound by the two bonds.
The knowledge of the similarity of the path has already arisen, but one has not yet abandoned the defilements of the first dhyÄna.

It is defiled by the three defilements.

Having already abandoned the defilements of the first dhyÄna, one enters the production of the correct view of separation from suffering, but the knowledge of the similarity of suffering has not yet arisen.

Defiled by three defilements.

Bound by six knots.
Bound by two fetters.

Bound by nine knots.
Bound by three fetters.

Entangled by ten entanglements.

Entangled by ten entanglements.

Bound by three fetters.

Defiled by six defilements.

Already free from attachment to desire realm, but not yet free from attachment to the first meditative absorption.
Having entered the correct state of renunciation, the cognition of the class of suffering has not yet arisen.
Bound by the six knots.
Bound by the two fetters.
Nine latent afflictions increase.
Defiled by the three defilements.
Entangled by the two entanglements.
The cognition of the class of suffering has arisen, but the cognition of the class of the path has not yet arisen.
Bound by the six knots.
Bound by the two fetters.
Seven latent afflictions increase.
Defiled by the three defilements.
Entangled by the two entanglements.

Bound by the three knots.
Bound by the two fetters.ğŸ”½Three latent afflictions increase.
Defiled by the three defilements.
Entangled by the two entanglements.
Already free from attachment to the first meditative absorption, having entered the correct state of renunciation, the cognition of the class of suffering has not yet arisen.
Bound by the six knots.
Bound by the two fetters.
Nine latent afflictions increase.
Defiled by one defilement.
Entangled by the two entanglements.
When the knowledge of the class of suffering has already arisen but the knowledge of the class of the path has not yet arisen,
one is bound by six fetters,
bound by two bonds,
and seven latent afflictions increase.
One is defiled by one stain,
and entangled by two entanglements.
When the knowledge of the class of the path has already arisen but one has not yet abandoned the defilements of the formless realm,
one is bound by three fetters,
bound by two bonds,
and three latent afflictions increase.
One is defiled by one stain,
and entangled by two entanglements.
Having already abandoned the defilements of the formless realm, one is not bound by any fetters,

The same applies to the cessation of the faculties of pleasure, pain, joy, sorrow, and equanimity.
The meaning of the other chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
Those who possess the eye faculty up to the formless realm,
and the cessation of the latent afflictions eliminated by cultivation,
the associated consciousness and the objects of that consciousness,
by how many fetters are they bound?
Up to by how many entanglements are they entangled?
The answer: Those who possess the cessation of the eye faculty up to the five faculties such as faith,
the associated consciousness and the objects of that consciousness, are bound by fetters.
Up to being bound by all the entanglements,
As explained before for one who has accomplished the cessation of the mental faculty.
The meaning of the other chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
One who has accomplished the eye faculty up to the formless realm,
And has severed the proclivity of ignorance that is to be eliminated by cultivation,ğŸ”½By how many fetters is one bound?
Up to being bound by how many entanglements?
The answer: One who has accomplished the eye faculty up to the five faculties such as faith, and has severed the path,
Is bound by all the fetters, up to being bound by all the entanglements,
Also as explained before for one who has accomplished the cessation of the mental faculty.
One who has accomplished the eye faculty up to the formless realm,
And has severed the proclivity of ignorance that is to be eliminated by cultivation,
The consciousness that takes as its object, as well as the consciousness that takes that as its object,
Is bound by all the fetters, up to being bound by all the entanglements,
As explained before for the consciousness that takes as its object, as well as the consciousness that takes that as its object,
The meaning of the other chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
One who has not accomplished the eye faculty up to the formless realm,
And has the proclivity of ignorance that is to be eliminated by cultivation,
How many bonds are one bound by, up to how many entanglements are one entangled by?
Answer: Those who do not possess the eye, ear, nose, tongue, female, or male faculties are bound by all bonds,
up to being entangled by all entanglements.
As explained before for those who possess the eye faculty.
Those who do not possess the body faculty, if they are ordinary beings,
are bound by six bonds.
They are bound by two fetters.
Nine latent afflictions increase.
They are defiled by one stain.
They are entangled by two entanglements.
If they are noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the formless realm,
they are bound by three bonds.
They are bound by two fetters.
Three latent afflictions increase.
They are defiled by one stain.
They are entangled by two entanglements.
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the formless realm are not bound by any bonds,
up to not being entangled by any entanglements.
Those who do not possess the faculties of pleasure or joy,
are bound by six bonds.
They are bound by two fetters.
Nine latent afflictions increase.
They are defiled by one stain.
They are entangled by two entanglements.
Those who do not possess the faculty of pain,
If an ordinary person has not yet abandoned the defilements of the first dhyana,
They are bound by six fetters,
Bound by two bonds,
And nine latent afflictions increase.
They are tainted by three defilements,
And entangled by two entanglements.
Having already abandoned the defilements of the first dhyana,
They are bound by six fetters,
Bound by two bonds,
And nine latent afflictions increase.
They are tainted by one defilement,

If a noble one has not yet abandoned the defilements of the first dhyana,
They are bound by three fetters,
Bound by two bonds,ğŸ”½And three latent afflictions increase.
They are tainted by three defilements,
And entangled by two entanglements.
Having already abandoned the defilements of the first dhyana but not yet abandoned the defilements of the formless realm,
They are bound by three fetters,
Bound by two bonds,
And three latent afflictions increase.
They are tainted by one defilement,
And entangled by two entanglements.
Having already abandoned the defilements of the formless realm, they are not bound by any fetters,
Up to not entangled by any entanglements.
As for those who do not possess the faculty of sorrow,
Those bound by all the fetters, up to those bound by all the envelopments,
are as explained in the case of one who has attained the cessation of the eye faculty.
As for those who do not possess the five faculties such as faith,
they are bound by nine fetters,
bound by three bonds,
with ten latent afflictions increasing,
defiled by six defilements,
and bound by ten envelopments.
As for those who do not possess the faculty of knowing the unknown,
if they are ordinary beings bound by all the fetters,
up to those bound by all the envelopments,
it is as explained in the case of an ordinary being who has attained the cessation of the eye faculty.
If they are noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm,
they are bound by six fetters,
bound by three bonds,
with four latent afflictions increasing,
defiled by six defilements,
and bound by ten envelopments.
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm but have not yet abandoned the defilements of the first concentration,
are bound by three fetters,
bound by two bonds,ğŸ”½with three latent afflictions increasing,
defiled by three defilements,
and bound by two envelopments.
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the first concentration but have not yet abandoned the defilements of the formless realm,
bound by the three fetters,
bound by the two bonds,
with the three latent afflictions increasing,
defiled by the one stain,
and entangled by the one fetter.
Those who are already free from the defilements of the formless realm are not bound by any fetters,
up to not entangled by any fetters.
Those who do not yet possess the faculty of perfect knowledge,
if they are ordinary beings,
are bound by the fetters and entangled by the fetters,
as explained before for ordinary beings who do not yet possess the faculty of understanding the unknown.
If they are noble ones,
in the path of seeing, not yet free from the defilements of the desire realm, with the knowledge of the aspects of the path not yet arisen,
they are bound by nine fetters,
bound by three bonds,
with ten latent afflictions increasing,
defiled by six stains,
and entangled by ten fetters.
When the knowledge of the aspects of the path has arisen,
they are bound by nine fetters,
bound by three bonds,
with eight latent afflictions increasing,
defiled by six stains,
and entangled by ten fetters.
Those who are already free from the defilements of the desire realm, but not yet free from the defilements of the first concentration, with the knowledge of the aspects of the path not yet arisen,
Bound by six knots.
Bound by two fetters.
Seven latent afflictions increase.
Defiled by three defilements.
Entangled by two entanglements.
When the cognition of the class of suffering has already arisen, one is bound by six knots.
Bound by two fetters.
Seven latent afflictions increase.
Defiled by three defilements.
Entangled by two entanglements.
Having already become free from the defilements of the first concentration, but the cognition of the class of suffering has not yet arisen.
Bound by six knots.
Bound by two fetters.
Nine latent afflictions increase.
Defiled by one defilement.
Entangled by two entanglements.
When the cognition of the class of suffering has already arisen.
Bound by six knots.
Bound by two fetters.
Seven latent afflictions increase.
Defiled by one defilement.
Entangled by two entanglements.
In the path of no-more-learning, there are no knots that bind.
Up to no entanglements that entangle.
One who does not possess the faculty of perfect knowledge.ğŸ”½If one is an ordinary person, one is bound by all the knots.
Up to being entangled by all the entanglements.
Entangled.
As explained before, those who have not yet attained the faculty of knowing that one has known are ordinary beings.
If noble ones in the path of seeing are bound by the fetters,
up to being entangled by the envelopments,
as explained before, those who have not yet attained the faculty of knowing that one has known are in the path of seeing.
In the path of cultivation, they are bound by the fetters,
up to being entangled by the envelopments.
As explained before, those who have not yet attained the faculty of knowing what is not yet known are in the path of cultivation.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
Those who have not yet attained the eye faculty up to the formless realm,
the dormant afflictions eliminated by cultivation,
the consciousness that takes them as objects, and the consciousness that takes that consciousness as its object,ğŸ”½by how many fetters are they bound?
Up to by how many envelopments are they entangled?
The answer: Those who have not yet attained the eye faculty as an object of consciousness,
are bound by six fetters,
bound by two bonds,
with nine dormant afflictions increasing,
defiled by one stain,
entangled by two envelopments.
Those who have not yet attained the ear, nose, tongue, body, female, male, suffering, and sorrow faculties,
as objects of consciousness,
and those who do not possess the female, male, suffering, and sorrow faculties.
The consciousness that takes them as objects is also the same.
The meaning of the other chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
Those who do not possess the eye faculty up to those in the formless realm.
The cessation of the dormant afflictions to be eliminated through cultivation.ğŸ”½By how many fetters are they bound?
Up to by how many entanglements are they entangled?
The answer: Those whose cessation is not possessing the eye faculty.
If one is an ordinary person in the desire realm,
they are bound by nine fetters.
They are bound by three bonds.
Ten latent afflictions increase.
They are defiled by six defilements.
They are entangled by ten entanglements.
Those above the sphere of infinite consciousness,
they are bound by six fetters.
They are bound by two bonds.
Nine latent afflictions increase.
They are defiled by one defilement.
They are entangled by two entanglements.
If an arhat is in the path of seeing or the path of cultivation, they are bound by fetters up to entangled by entanglements.
As previously explained for arhats not yet free from attachment to desire in the paths of seeing and cultivation.
The same applies to those who have not yet eliminated the faculties of ear, nose, tongue, body, female, male, pleasure, or pain.
There are differences.
Those who have not yet eliminated the faculty of female, male, or pain,
should be said to be in the second dhyÄna or above.
Those who have not yet eliminated the faculty of pleasure,
should be said to be in the third dhyÄna or above, bound by all fetters,
and in the sphere of infinite space or above.
Those who have not yet eliminated the faculty of joy,
if they are ordinary beings in the desire realm, bound by all fetters,
they are bound by nine fetters.
They are bound by three fetters.
Ten latent afflictions increase.
They are defiled by six defilements.
They are entangled by ten entanglements.
If they are in the fourth dhyÄna or above,
they are bound by six fetters.
They are bound by two fetters.
Nine latent afflictions increase.
They are defiled by one defilement.
They are entangled by two entanglements.
If noble ones, bound by all fetters, enter the correct state of renunciation for the first moment,
they are bound by nine fetters.
They are bound by three fetters.
Ten latent afflictions increase.
Six defilements contaminate.
Ten entanglements entangle.
Those who do not possess the faculty of sorrow and have ceased are also like this.
There is a difference.
It should be said that those in the second dhyÄna and above
Those who do not possess the faculty of life, and the five faculties such as faith, and have ceased,
Are bound by all the bonds, up to entangled by all the entanglements.
If one is an ordinary person as before, not yet free from desire, it refers to all ordinary persons.
If one is a noble one, in the path of seeing or the path of cultivation,
As before, not yet free from desire, it refers to all noble ones in the path of seeing or the path of cultivation.
Those who do not possess the faculty of thought or the faculty of equanimity and have ceased,
If one is an ordinary person with complete bonds,
If one is a noble one with complete bonds,
Entering the first moment of the correct generation of the resolve for enlightenment,
One is bound by all nine bonds,
Bound by the three fetters,
Ten latent afflictions increase,
Six defilements contaminate,
Ten entanglements entangle.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
Those who do not possess the eye faculty up to those in the formless realm,
the cessation of the ignorance that is eliminated by cultivation,
the consciousness that takes it as an object and the consciousness that takes that as an object,
by how many fetters are they bound?
Up to by how many entanglements are they entangled?
The answer: The cessation of the consciousness that takes as an object the non-possession of the eye faculty,
is bound by six fetters,
bound by two bonds,
with nine latent afflictions increasing,
defiled by one stain,
and entangled by two entanglements.
The cessation of the consciousness that takes as an object the non-possession of the ear, nose, tongue, body, pleasure, or joy faculties,
and the cessation of the consciousness that takes as an object the non-possession of the female, male, suffering, or depression faculties,
and the consciousness that takes that as an object, is also the same.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
Those who do not possess the eye faculty,
up to those in the formless realm,
the path to the elimination of the ignorance that is eliminated by cultivation,ğŸ”½by how many fetters are they bound?
Up to by how many entanglements are they entangled?
The answer: The path to the elimination of the non-possession of the eye faculty,
if one is an ordinary person in the desire realm,
Bound by nine fetters.
Bound by three bonds.
Ten latent afflictions increase.
Defiled by six defilements.
Entangled by ten entanglements.
Above the sphere of infinite consciousness,
Bound by six fetters.
Bound by two bonds.
Nine latent afflictions increase.
Defiled by one defilement.
Entangled by two entanglements.
If noble ones are bound by fetters in the paths of seeing and cultivation,
Up to being entangled by entanglements,
It is said that those noble ones in the paths of seeing and cultivation who have not yet abandoned attachment to desire are like this.
Those who have not yet attained the faculties of ear, nose, tongue, body, female, male, pleasure, or pain are also like this.
There are differences.
Those who have not yet attained the faculties of female, male, or pain,

Should say that those who have not yet attained the path of abandoning pleasure are above the second concentration.ğŸ”½Those who have not yet attained the path of abandoning pleasure should say that those who have not yet entered the path of preparation,
And those who have not yet attained the path of abandoning joy are above the sphere of infinite space.
If ordinary beings are in the desire realm,
they are bound by nine fetters,
bound by three bonds,
with ten latent afflictions increasing,
defiled by six defilements,
and entangled by ten entanglements.
If they are in the fourth meditative absorption and above,
they are bound by six fetters,
bound by two bonds,
with nine latent afflictions increasing,
defiled by one defilement,
and entangled by two entanglements.
If noble ones are in the path of seeing or the path of cultivation, they are bound by fetters,
up to being entangled by entanglements.
It is the same as explaining the noble ones who have not yet separated from desire-realm attachment in the paths of seeing and cultivation.
Those who have eliminated the path of not possessing the faculty of sorrow are also like this.
The difference is:
It should be said that in the second meditative absorption and above,
those who have eliminated the path of not possessing the faculties of life, faith, etc.,
whether ordinary beings or noble ones,
are bound by fetters, up to being entangled by entanglements.
It is the same as explaining ordinary beings and noble ones who have eliminated the path of not possessing the eye faculty in the desire realm.
As for those who do not possess the mental faculty and the faculty of equanimity, the path of elimination,
whether ordinary beings or noble ones,
bound by all the bonds, up to entangled by all the entanglements,
as before, in the desire realm, they do not possess the faculty of joy, the path of elimination, ordinary beings and noble ones are explained.
The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
As for those who do not possess the eye faculty up to the formless realm,
the path of eliminating the dormant afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation,
the consciousness that takes it as object and the consciousness that takes that as object,
how many bonds are they bound by?
Up to entangled by how many entanglements?
The answer is: As for the consciousness that takes the path of eliminating the faculty of femininity as object,
it is bound by six bonds,
bound by two fetters,
with nine dormant afflictions increasing,
defiled by one stain,
entangled by two entanglements.

The consciousness that takes the path of eliminating the male faculty, the faculty of suffering, and the faculty of sorrow as object is also like this.ğŸ”½The meaning of the remaining chapters should be understood by analogy with this.
The rest of the categories should be explained by analogy with the previous.
